ndio.utils package¶

Submodules¶

ndio.utils.mesh module¶

ndio.utils.mesh.export_dae(filename, cutout, level=0)¶

Converts a dense annotation to a DAE, using Marching Cubes (PyMCubes).

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – The filename to write out to
  • cutout (numpy.ndarray) – The dense annotation
  • level (int) – The level at which to run mcubes
Returns:

boolean success
ndio.utils.mesh.export_obj(filename, cutout, level=0)¶

Converts a dense annotation to a obj, using Marching Cubes (PyMCubes).

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – The filename to write out to
  • cutout (numpy.ndarray) – The dense annotation
  • level (int) – The level at which to run mcubes
Returns:

boolean success
ndio.utils.mesh.export_ply(filename, cutout, level=0)¶

Converts a dense annotation to a .PLY, using Marching Cubes (PyMCubes).

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – The filename to write out to
  • cutout (numpy.ndarray) – The dense annotation
  • level (int) – The level at which to run mcubes
Returns:

boolean success

ndio.utils.parallel module¶

ndio.utils.parallel.block_compute(x_start, x_stop, y_start, y_stop, z_start, z_stop, origin=(0, 0, 1), block_size=(256, 256, 16))¶

Get bounding box coordinates (in 3D) of small cutouts to request in order to reconstitute a larger cutout.

Parameters:
  • Q_start (int) – The lower bound of dimension ‘Q’
  • Q_stop (int) – The upper bound of dimension ‘Q’
Returns:

[((x_start, x_stop), (y_start, y_stop), (z_start, z_stop)), ... ]
ndio.utils.parallel.snap_to_cube(q_start, q_stop, chunk_depth=16, q_index=1)¶

For any q in {x, y, z, t} Takes in a q-range and returns a 1D bound that starts at a cube boundary and ends at another cube boundary and includes the volume inside the bounds. For instance, snap_to_cube(2, 3) = (1, 17)

Parameters:
  • q_start (int) – The lower bound of the q bounding box of volume
  • q_stop (int) – The upper bound of the q bounding box of volume
  • (int (q_index) – CHUNK_DEPTH) The size of the chunk in this volume (use get_info())
  • (int – 1): The starting index of the volume (in q)
Returns:

(lo, hi) bounding box for the volume
Return type:

2-tuple

ndio.utils.stats module¶

ndio.utils.stats.connected_components(data)¶

Run a jank implementation of connected-components on a bit of data. Probably shouldn’t live here but it does for now.
